title: Finding the Foci with c
text: We know that $$a=36$$ and $$b=25$$. So, we can solve for c using the equation $$c=\sqrt{a^2-b^2}$$, leading to $$\sqrt{11}$$. So, the foci are (-3,-1-sqrt(11)),(-3,-1+sqrt(11))
speech: We know that  a is equal to 36  and  b, is equal to 25 . So, we can solve for c using the equation  c, is equal to the square root of a squared minus b squared end root , leading to  the square root of 11 . So, the foci are (-3,-1-sqrt(11)),(-3,-1+sqrt(11))
